summary: This is a Department of Justice Morning News Digest from July 10, 2020, summarizing major news headlines across various topics including DOJ activities, Supreme Court rulings, and criminal cases. It includes a brief mention of Ghislaine Maxwell's jail conditions following her arrest in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Recently arrested confidant of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as being given paper clothes at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn over fears she might attempt suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the associate of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items regarding DOJ initiatives, a visit to Arkansas, and the removal of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Referenced in a news item about his removal by Attorney General Barr, noting he had launched investigations into Trump's allies.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.role: Former personal attorney to President Trump
persons.context: Reported as being taken back into custody for violating terms of his early release from prison.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in context of Supreme Court rulings on his financial records, the economy, and administration policies.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned as criticizing President Trump on the economy.

persons.name: Emmet Sullivan
persons.context: Mentioned as asking for a full appeals court review of an order to dismiss the case against Michael Flynn.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Referenced in a news item about the judge appealing an order to dismiss charges against him.

persons.name: Roger Stone
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item about the DOJ reversing its position on his bid to delay his prison sentence.

persons.name: Asa Hutchinson
persons.context: Mentioned as meeting with Attorney General William Barr during his visit to Arkansas.

persons.name: Tom Cotton
persons.context: Mentioned as meeting with Attorney General William Barr during his visit to Arkansas.

persons.name: Leslie Rutledge
persons.context: Mentioned as meeting with Attorney General William Barr during his visit to Arkansas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Levine
persons.context: Reported as telling reporters about Cohen being taken into custody.

persons.name: Luke Barr
persons.context: Listed as a co-author on ABC News reports about Attorney General Barr and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark Osborne
persons.context: Listed as a co-author on an ABC News report about Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as a recently arrested confidant of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
Barr announced the removal of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, who had investigated Trump's allies.
Cohen is described as President Trump's former personal attorney and fixer.
Barr met with Governor Hutchinson during a visit to Arkansas.
Barr met with Senator Cotton during a visit to Arkansas.
Barr met with Arkansas Attorney General Rutledge during a visit to Arkansas.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell given paper clothes in jail
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was given paper clothes upon checking into the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn over fears she might take her own life.

events.title: Michael Cohen taken back into custody
events.description: Michael Cohen was taken into custody for violating the terms of his early release from prison, specifically for failing to agree to terms of federal location monitoring.

events.title: Supreme Court rules on Trump financial records
events.description: The Supreme Court ruled that New York prosecutor Cy Vance can see Trump's tax returns, stating the president cannot block the release of his financial records.

events.title: Attorney General Barr visits Arkansas
events.description: Attorney General William Barr visited Little Rock, Arkansas, to attend a Federal and Local Law Enforcement Roundtable and met with state officials.

events.title: Judge appeals order to dismiss Michael Flynn case
events.description: U.S. District Court Judge Emmet Sullivan asked for a full appeals court review of an order telling him to dismiss the case against former national security adviser Michael Flynn.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was given paper clothes at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn due to suicide prevention concerns following her arrest.
The document is a DOJ news digest covering a wide range of topics from July 10, 2020, with only a single, brief mention of the Epstein case regarding Maxwell's jail conditions.
Attorney General William Barr was actively involved in multiple DOJ initiatives and faced scrutiny over the removal of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman.
The Supreme Court issued significant rulings limiting presidential power, specifically regarding access to President Trump's financial records.
Michael Cohen, President Trump's former lawyer, was taken back into federal custody for violating the terms of his home confinement.
